thread.title: Report: UGA hires DL coach away from SEC school
thread.title_full: Report: UGA hires DL coach away from SEC school

title: Report: UGA hires DL coach away from SEC school
text:
Report: UGA hires DL coach away from SEC school Georgia has hired a defensive line coach per FootballScoop.com Slot to Georgia Links 
Georgia has filled its defensive line coaching job. According to a report from FootballScoop.com, Kirby Smart has elected to hire Tray Scott , who holds the same position at Ole Miss. 
Ole Miss head coach Huge Freeze released a statement soon after Football Scoop's report, confirming that Scott is indeed leaving the Rebel program. 
“Tray Scott is leaving our staff for another opportunity," Freeze said in the statement. "We want coaches that are 100 percent committed to winning championships at Ole Miss. Our student-athletes, our staff and Rebel Nation deserve that, and that is what we will bring to this great program.” Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
Scott was at North Carolina for the past two seasons before joining the Ole Miss staff. While in Chapel Hill he helped develop Nazair Jones into an All-ACC performer two-straight seasons. He also helped improve a Tar Heel defense that improved its scoring defense by over 14 points from the previous season in 2015. That year UNC played Clemson in the ACC Championship Game and finished as the nation's No. 15 team. 
The Tar Heels have had the ACC's worst rush defense in yards per game for the past two seasons. It has ranked 11th (2016) and 13th (2015) in the 14-team league the past two seasons and 11th (2016) and 10th (2015) in sacks. 
Before that he was at the University of Tennessee at Martin in 2013 and 2014. He has also spent time at Ole Miss as a graduate assistant and on Hugh Freeze's staff at Arkansas State. 
A former defensive lineman at Arkansas Tech, Scott is being brought in to replace Tracy Rocker . UGA officials confirmed on Tuesday that Rocker was no longer part of the Bulldog coaching staff after spending three years in Athens. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
